content: this legal text explains the progress of a case in the court of santa maria cv the case involves a dispute over the division of a hereditary community and a piece of land the plaintiffs mr di gi sa and his wife sued mr di gi lo alleging that the land was inherited from their deceased mother and should be divided among the heirs the defendants contested the claims and argued that the sale of the land had already been agreed upon and that the statute of limitations had expired the court examined the evidence presented including private deeds and notarial deeds and concluded that the sale of the land was valid and that the division should proceed according to the shares assigned to each party the court also addressed a counterclaim made by the defendants regarding the ownership of a share acquired by mr pe as ruling in favor of the defendants finally the court ordered the dissolution of the hereditary community and the division of the land according to a proposed project the judgment can be transcribed and the parties are responsible for the costs of the litigation including expert witnesses in this legal case the santa maria court has made a final ruling the court has ordered the dissolution of a hereditary community and has assigned certain properties to specific individuals the court has also ordered the division of land between the plaintiffs and the defendant the court has awarded the costs of the litigation to both parties and has split the costs of the courtappointed expert witness between the plaintiffs and the defendant finally the court has rejected the claims brought by both parties this ruling was made on july 24 2017
